content: I swapped the last test and validator so a solutions along the lines of `tr "123" "@-@"` will fail the test and not just the validator.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I really enjoyed this challenge. Thanks!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's clear, succinct and fun: perfect for a clash of code.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Doable in <5min, and clear for reverse players as well.

Your contribution has been uploaded twice, Please remove one of them. The other link is:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/83835b49a42f971173be62e15931e24d87659

Goal
* As an example has been shown in Example section, you don't have to show any example here, unless you include additional explanation.

(Also note that the variable formatting is wrong; the characters and the answers should be formatted as {{constants}} and also have the monospace format applied.)

* Please rewrite this section as follows:

Create a square pattern consisting of the 3 given characters, where the first character fills the outer border, the second character fills the inner border, and the third character forms the core.

Input
* Please delete "charcters" (which is also a typo).

* Please add "3 space-separated characters" after "line 1:".

Constraints
* Please leave the section blank if there are no constraints.

Cases
* Suggest to add pairs of cases where two of the characters are the same (1st and 2nd, 1st and 3rd, and 2nd and 3rd).

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write pattern").

Thanks.

Hello there, your contribution has been uploaded twice... see https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/83835b49a42f971173be62e15931e24d87659

Please remove one of the listings, thanks.

The contribution itself is very interesting looking.

Goal
* Please rewrite as follows as the current statement is inadequate.

Create a square pattern consisting of the 3 given characters, where the first character fills the outer border, the second character fills the inner border, and the third character forms the core.

Input
* Please delete "`".

* Please format "chr1", "chr2", "chr3" as [[variables]] instead of {{constants}}.

Thanks.
